title: AI Digest — AI-Ready Chemistry Secures Drug Supply, Plus ChatGPT's Shopping Edge
name: Yi Qu
summary: Biotech startup Excelsior Sciences raised $95 million to scale its "smart bloccs" platform, which integrates AI-driven drug discovery with automated, machine-friendly chemistry for manufacturing.

title: What I Learned About the Future of Work from Microsoft's Internal HR Transformation
excerpt: Today I attended a webinar regarding Microsoft’s Internal HR Transformation, featuring leaders from Microsoft. Here’s What I Learned About the Future of Work.
name: Yi Qu

title: How I Decide When to Split a Document for AI (and My Simple Rules)
excerpt: When I first used AI to search my notes, I dropped giant files into the system and hoped for magic. Instead, I got slow searches, vague answers, and sometimes the AI skipped the one section I needed. So I changed my approach. Now, before I upload anything, I pause and ask: Should I split this into smaller pieces, or keep it as one file?
name: Yi Qu

title: AI Digest — Gemini 3 and the Global AI Infrastructure Race
excerpt: Today's AI Digest covers major global developments, including Google's launch of the advanced Gemini 3 model integrated into Search, a significant European effort to build an AI data 'gigafactory,' and the growing trend of US startups utilizing free Chinese AI models.
name: Yi Qu

title: Start Orchestrating AI: Why Your Company Needs a Conductor, Not Just Bridges
excerpt: I recently read the incredibly insightful report from Zapier, Beyond integration: Why top enterprises are choosing AI orchestration, and I wanted to share what I learned from this report about why modern businesses need to stop just integrating AI and start orchestrating it.

title: Forget Chatbots: The AI Revolution Is Moving to Autonomous Agents
excerpt: I just read the new introduction to agents white paper from Google, and it covers an important topic: Artificial Intelligence is undergoing a fundamental shift. For years, AI was passive, focused on discrete tasks like generating text or answering one question. It needed constant human guidance.

title: AI Digest — AI's Job Impact and Google's Hardware Push
excerpt: A new MIT study estimates that current AI systems are technically and economically capable of performing tasks equivalent to 11.7% of the U.S. labor market, representing about $1.2 trillion in wages.
